query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Quando il settentrïon del primo cielo, 2 che né occaso mai seppe né orto 3 né d’altra nebbia che di colpa velo,
query.error: **English:** 1 When the north of the first heaven, 2 which never knew setting nor rising, 3 nor any veil of cloud except of sin,
query.result: 1 Yada prathama-svargasya uttara-diś, 2 yā kadācid api astadayam na jānāti na udayam 3 na ca anyena megheṇa yaḥ ācchāditaḥ asti pāpa-megham vinā,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 e che faceva lì ciascun accorto 5 di suo dover, come ’l più basso face 6 qual temon gira per venire a porto,
query.error: **English:** 4 and which made everyone there aware 5 of his duty, as the lower one does 6 when the rudder turns to come to port,
query.result: 4 yaś ca tatra sarvān svakarmaṇi niyojayati 5 yathā adhamaḥ dhanuḥ-koṇaḥ āgacchati nausthala-prāpti-artham, 6 sthiraḥ sthitaḥ: satya-janaḥ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 fermo s’affisse: la gente verace, 8 venuta prima tra ’l grifone ed esso, 9 al carro volse sé come a sua pace;
query.error: **English:** 7 stood still: the truthful people, 8 who had come first between the griffin and it, 9 turned to the chariot as to their peace;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 e un di loro, quasi da ciel messo, 11 ‘Veni, sponsa, de Libano’ cantando 12 gridò tre volte, e tutti li altri appresso.
query.error: **English:** 10 And one of them, as if sent from heaven, 11 singing ‘Veni, sponsa, de Libano’ 12 cried out three times, and all the others after him.
query.result: 10 Tataś ca teṣu madhye ekaḥ svargāt pravṛtta iva, 11 ‘Veni, sponsa, de Libano’ iti gāyan 12 trīṇi varāni akarod, anye ca tasya paścāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Quali i beati al novissimo bando 14 surgeran presti ognun di sua caverna, 15 la revestita voce alleluiando,
query.error: **English:** 13 As the blessed at the final summons 14 will rise up quickly, each from his cavern, 15 their voices clothed in hallelujahs,
query.result: 13 Yathā śubhāḥ antyameva samayam 14 uttiṣṭhanti śīghram ekaikaḥ svakāyāt, 15 halleluyāḥ ācchādayantī vācam,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 cotali in su la divina basterna 17 si levar cento, ad vocem tanti senis, 18 ministri e messaggier di vita etterna.
query.error: **English:** 16 so on the divine litter 17 a hundred rose up, at the voice of so old a man, 18 ministers and messengers of eternal life.
query.result: 16 tathā divyāyām bastarṇyāyām 17 uttiṣṭhanti śatam, tathāvidhasya vṛddhasya vāṇyā, 18 nityajīvanasya sevākaraṇakartāraḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Tutti dicean: ‘Benedictus qui venis!’, 20 e fior gittando e di sopra e dintorno, 21 ‘Manibus, oh, date lilïa plenis!’.
query.error: **English:** 19 All were saying: ‘Blessed are you who come!’, 20 and throwing flowers above and around, 21 ‘Oh, give lilies with your hands!’
query.result: 19 Sarve ahaṃs: ‘Benedictus qui venis!’, 20 Puṣpāṇi kṣipantaḥ upari ca paritaś ca, 21 ‘Manibus, āha, date lilïa plenis!’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Io vidi già nel cominciar del giorno 23 la parte orïental tutta rosata, 24 e l’altro ciel di bel sereno addorno;
query.error: **English:** 22 At the beginning of the day, I saw 23 the eastern sky all rosy, 24 and the other sky adorned with beautiful serenity;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 e la faccia del sol nascere ombrata, 26 sì che per temperanza di vapori 27 l’occhio la sostenea lunga fïata:
query.error: **English:** 25 and the face of the sun rising veiled, 26 so that, due to the moderation of vapors, 27 the eye could bear it for a long time:
query.result: 25 sūryasya ca mukham udayamānam āvṛtam, 26 yathā vāṣpa-saṃyamāt 27 cakṣuḥ tena saha cirakālam sthātum śaknuyāt:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 così dentro una nuvola di fiori 29 che da le mani angeliche saliva 30 e ricadeva in giù dentro e di fori,
query.error: **English:** 28 thus, within a cloud of flowers 29 that rose from angelic hands 30 and fell back down inside and outside,
query.result: 28 evam puṣpameghe 29 yaḥ devahastāt utthitaḥ 30 punaśca antaḥ bahiśca nipatitaḥ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 sovra candido vel cinta d’uliva 32 donna m’apparve, sotto verde manto 33 vestita di color di fiamma viva.
query.error: **English:** 31 upon a white veil, crowned with olive, 32 a lady appeared to me, beneath a green mantle, 33 dressed in the color of a living flame.
query.result: 31 śuklavarṇe vastre jaitūnapuṣpeṇa śobhamāne 32 strī mama pratibhāti, harita-vastreṇa āvṛtā, 33 jīvajvālāvarṇe vastreṇa paridhṛtā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 E lo spirito mio, che già cotanto 35 tempo era stato ch’a la sua presenza 36 non era di stupor, tremando, affranto,
query.error: **English:** 34 And my spirit, which had been so long 35 a time that it was not astonished at its presence, 36 trembling and exhausted, without knowledge,
query.result: 34 Eva ca me manaḥ, yat pūrvaṃ ciraṃ kālam āsīt 35 Yāvat tasya sannidhau na āsīt vismayaḥ, kāmpamānaṃ, klāntam, 36 Netrāṇām api jñānam vinā,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 sanza de li occhi aver più conoscenza, 38 per occulta virtù che da lei mosse, 39 d’antico amor sentì la gran potenza.
query.error: **English:** 37 without having any more knowledge of her through his eyes, 38 through a hidden virtue that moved from her, 39 he felt the great power of ancient love.
query.result: 37 tasyāḥ cakṣuṣoḥ vinā api jñānam, 38 tayāḥ prakṛṣṭayā śaktyā yā tayāḥ pravṛttā, 39 pūrvasya preṇaḥ mahatīṃ śaktiṃ anubabhāva.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Tosto che ne la vista mi percosse 41 l’alta virtù che già m’avea trafitto 42 prima ch’io fuor di püerizia fosse,
query.error: **English:** 40 As soon as my sight was struck by 41 the noble spirit who had already pierced me 42 before I was out of boyhood,
query.result: 40 Yathā yathā me darśane āpatat 41 Sā parā śaktiḥ yā pūrvam eva mām viddhavān 42 Adyāpi bālyāt pūrvam eva,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 volsimi a la sinistra col respitto 44 col quale il fantolin corre a la mamma 45 quando ha paura o quando elli è afflitto,
query.error: **English:** 43 I turned to the left with the respect 44 with which a little child runs to his mother 45 when he is afraid or when he is distressed,
query.result: 43 Tathā tathā vāme bhāge mama bhaktiḥ jāta 44 Yathā bālakaḥ bhayāt vā duḥkhāt vā mātaraṃ prati dhāvati, 45 Tathā aham api ‘Virgilia! Mama śarīre eka-drammāt api alpam raktam eva śeṣam asti, yat na kampate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 per dicere a Virgilio: ‘Men che dramma 47 di sangue m’è rimaso che non tremi: 48 conosco i segni de l’antica fiamma’.
query.error: **English:** 46 to say to Virgil: ‘Less than a dram 47 of blood is left in me that does not tremble: 48 I recognize the signs of the ancient flame’.
query.result: 46 ‘Virgilio’ iti vaktuṃ: ‘Drammāt api alpaṃ 47 mama raktam avasiṣṭam yaḥ na kampate: 48 jānāmi pūrvasya snehasya lakṣaṇāni’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Ma Virgilio n’avea lasciati scemi 50 di sé, Virgilio dolcissimo patre, 51 Virgilio a cui per mia salute die’mi;
query.error: **English:** 49 But Virgil had left us bereft 50 of himself, Virgil, the sweetest father, 51 Virgil to whom I said for my salvation;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 né quantunque perdeo l’antica matre, 53 valse a le guance nette di rugiada, 54 che, lagrimando, non tornasser atre.
query.error: **English:** 52 nor, however much he lost his ancient mother, 53 did it avail his cheeks, clean of dew, 54 that, weeping, they did not return wet.
query.result: 52 Na ca yadyapi tena prāptā pūrvajananī, 53 Na śaknute tasya kapolāni ambunā vinā, 54 Yāni aśrubhiḥ pūrṇāni punar na bhavanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 «Dante, perché Virgilio se ne vada, 56 non pianger anco, non piangere ancora; 57 ché pianger ti conven per altra spada».
query.error: **English:** 55 "Dante, why do you weep because Virgil departs, 56 do not weep yet, do not weep yet; 57 for it is fitting for you to weep for another sword."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Quasi ammiraglio che in poppa e in prora 59 viene a veder la gente che ministra 60 per li altri legni, e a ben far l’incora;
query.error: **English:** 58 Like an admiral who on poop and prow 59 comes to see the people who are working 60 on the other ships, and to set the course;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 in su la sponda del carro sinistra, 62 quando mi volsi al suon del nome mio, 63 che di necessità qui si registra,
query.error: **English:** 61 on the left side of the chariot, 62 when I turned at the sound of my name, 63 which must be recorded here,
query.result: 61 ratha-vāmasya-pārśve, 62 yadā ahaṃ avavṛtaiḥ śabdena mama nāmaṇaḥ, 63 yaḥ niścayaḥ atra likhitaḥ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 vidi la donna che pria m’appario 65 velata sotto l’angelica festa, 66 drizzar li occhi ver’ me di qua dal rio.
query.error: **English:** 64 I saw the lady who had appeared to me before, 65 veiled beneath angelic joy, 66 turn her eyes toward me from across the stream.
query.result: 64 apaśyam strīṃ yā pūrvam mām abhāsayat, 65 āvṛtā devatā-maṅgalena, 66 nirikṣitum mama prati diśaḥ nadī-pārasya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Tutto che ’l vel che le scendea di testa, 68 cerchiato de le fronde di Minerva, 69 non la lasciasse parer manifesta,

query.result: 67 Sarvam yat vastram tasya śirasaḥ patitam, 68 parivestitam Minerva-patrair, 69 na tasyāṃ prakāśamānam darśayati sma,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 regalmente ne l’atto ancor proterva 71 continüò come colui che dice 72 e ’l più caldo parlar dietro reserva:
query.error: **English:** 70 regally in her still haughty demeanor 71 she continued like one who speaks 72 and reserves the warmest words for last:
query.result: 70 rājyeva tadāpi garvam āśritya 71 sa vyavaharati sma yathā saḥ yaḥ kathayati 72 uttamam ca vacanam paścāt sthāpayati:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 «Guardaci ben! Ben son, ben son Beatrice. 74 Come degnasti d’accedere al monte? 75 non sapei tu che qui è l’uom felice?».
query.error: **English:** 73 “Look at me well! I am indeed, I am indeed Beatrice. 74 How were you deemed worthy to ascend the mountain? 75 Do you not know that here is where the happy man dwells?”.
query.result: 73 “Paśya mām samyak! Aham eva aham eva Beatrice. 74 Katham tvam adrim āroḍhuṃ śaktaḥ? 75 Na jānāsi tvam atra sukhamānasasya sthānam iti?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Li occhi mi cadder giù nel chiaro fonte; 77 ma veggendomi in esso, i trassi a l’erba, 78 tanta vergogna mi gravò la fronte.
query.error: **English:** 76 My eyes fell down into the clear spring; 77 but seeing myself in it, I withdrew them to the grass, 78 so great was the shame that weighed upon my brow.
query.result: 76 Mama netrāni nirmale jale patitvāni, 77 Ātmānam tatra dṛṣṭvā, tṛṇam prati apavartante sma, 78 Tāvad alajjā mama lalāṭam abhipīḍayām āsa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Così la madre al figlio par superba, 80 com’ ella parve a me; perché d’amaro 81 sente il sapor de la pietade acerba.
query.error: **English:** 79 Thus the mother to the son appeared proud, 80 as she appeared to me; because the taste of bitter 81 pity she feels.
query.result: 79 Evam mātā putram prati adṛṣṭapūrvaṃ 80 yathā mayi adṛśyata; katham api kaṭukam 81 karuṇāyāḥ rasam anubhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Ella si tacque; e li angeli cantaro 83 di sùbito ‘In te, Domine, speravi’; 84 ma oltre ‘pedes meos’ non passaro.
query.error: **English:** 82 She was silent; and the angels suddenly sang 83 "In te, Domine, speravi"; 84 but they did not go beyond "pedes meos".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Sì come neve tra le vive travi 86 per lo dosso d’Italia si congela, 87 soffiata e stretta da li venti schiavi,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 poi, liquefatta, in sé stessa trapela, 89 pur che la terra che perde ombra spiri, 90 sì che par foco fonder la candela;
query.error: **English:** 88 then, liquefied, it trickles into itself, 89 as soon as the earth that loses its shadow breathes, 90 so that it seems like fire melting a candle;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 così fui sanza lagrime e sospiri 92 anzi ’l cantar di quei che notan sempre 93 dietro a le note de li etterni giri;
query.error: **English:** 91 thus I was without tears and sighs, 92 rather with the song of those who always row 93 following the notes of the eternal circles;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 ma poi che ’ntesi ne le dolci tempre 95 lor compatire a me, par che se detto 96 avesser: ‘Donna, perché sì lo stempre?’,
query.error: **English:** 94 but after I heard in their sweet melodies 95 their pity for me, it seemed as if they said: 96 "Lady, why do you waste away so?",
query.result: 94 yadā tu aham śṛṇomi madhura-tāleṣu 95 teṣāṃ mayi anugrahaṃ, tathā iva uktam abhūt: 96 "Bhavati, kimartham evam ātmanam kṣipasi?",

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 lo gel che m’era intorno al cor ristretto, 98 spirito e acqua fessi, e con angoscia 99 de la bocca e de li occhi uscì del petto.
query.error: **English:** 97 the ice that was constricted around my heart 98 turned into spirit and water, and with anguish 99 it exited my chest through my mouth and eyes.
query.result: 97 himaḥ yaḥ me hṛdayasya paritaḥ saṃhataḥ āsīt, 98 prāṇaḥ apāḥ ca abhūt, caiveṇa ca śokena 99 mukhataḥ netrābhyaśca hṛdayāt niṣkrāntaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Ella, pur ferma in su la detta coscia 101 del carro stando, a le sustanze pie 102 volse le sue parole così poscia:
query.error: **English:** 100 She, still standing on the said haunch 101 of the chariot, turned her words to the pious substances 102 thus afterward:
query.result: 100 Sā, tathāpi niścalā uktāyāṃ janghāyāṃ 101 rathasya sthitvā, dharmātmabhyaḥ padārthebhyaḥ 102 evam paścāt svān vacasāṃ pravṛttim cakāra:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 «Voi vigilate ne l’etterno die, 104 sì che notte né sonno a voi non fura 105 passo che faccia il secol per sue vie;
query.error: **English:** 103 "You keep watch in the eternal day, 104 so that neither night nor sleep steals from you 105 any step that the world takes on its paths;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 onde la mia risposta è con più cura 107 che m’intenda colui che di là piagne, 108 perché sia colpa e duol d’una misura.
query.error: **English:** 106 therefore my answer is with greater care 107 so that he who weeps over there may understand me, 108 so that the fault and the grief may be of one measure.
query.result: 106 atas tvam mama pratyuttaram atiśayena yatnena 107 me śṛṇotu yaḥ tatra paridevati, 108 yathā 'parādhaḥ duḥkham ca samaparimāṇam bhavetām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Non pur per ovra de le rote magne, 110 che drizzan ciascun seme ad alcun fine 111 secondo che le stelle son compagne,
query.error: **English:** 109 Not only through the operation of the great wheels, 110 which direct every seed to some end, 111 according to the constellations that accompany them,
query.result: 109 Na kevalam mahāntānāṃ cakrāṇāṃ pravartanāt, 110 yāni sarvam bījam kaścitkālaḥ prati niyamantaḥ prayacchanti, 111 yathā nakṣatrāṇi sāhacaryam kurvanti,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 ma per larghezza di grazie divine, 113 che sì alti vapori hanno a lor piova, 114 che nostre viste là non van vicine,
query.error: **English:** 112 but also through the breadth of divine grace, 113 which rains down such lofty vapors upon them, 114 that our sight cannot reach them,
query.result: 112 api tu daivīkānāṃ prasādānāṃ vistārāt, 113 ye evam uttamān rasān tेषāṃ vṛṣṭyā kṣipanti, 114 yatra asmākaṃ dṛṣṭayaḥ na upapadyante,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 questi fu tal ne la sua vita nova 116 virtüalmente, ch’ogne abito destro 117 fatto averebbe in lui mirabil prova.
query.error: **English:** 115 this man was such in his new life 116 potentially, that every worthy habit 117 would have made a marvelous demonstration in him.
query.result: 115 ayam puruṣaḥ asmims tan nūtane jīvite 116 śakyatvena, yathā sarvaḥ śubhaḥ ācāraḥ 117 tasmin adbhutam parīkṣaṇam kuryāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Ma tanto più maligno e più silvestro 119 si fa ’l terren col mal seme e non cólto, 120 quant’ elli ha più di buon vigor terrestro.
query.error: **English:** 118 But the more malignant and more savage 119 the land becomes with bad seed and untilled, 120 the more it has of good terrestrial vigor.
query.result: 118 Api ca tatraiva bhūmiḥ adhikaṃ durjanā adhikaṃ aranya iva bhavati 119 yadā sā durbījena saha bhavati na ca kṛṣyate, 120 yāvatyā eva sā adhikaṃ bhūtale śubhe balavati bhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 Alcun tempo il sostenni col mio volto: 122 mostrando li occhi giovanetti a lui, 123 meco il menava in dritta parte vòlto.
query.error: **English:** 121 For some time I sustained him with my face, 122 showing him my youthful eyes, 123 and with me he went, turned toward the right path.
query.result: 121 Kalam yasyaham adhārayām ātmīyena vaktreṇa, 122 Darśayanti sma taruṇau netre tasmai, 123 Saham eva nayati sma tam vāmāṅgam abhimukham kṛtvā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Sì tosto come in su la soglia fui 125 di mia seconda etade e mutai vita, 126 questi si tolse a me, e diessi altrui.
query.error: **English:** 124 As soon as I was on the threshold 125 of my second age and changed my life, 126 this one took himself away from me and gave himself to another.
query.result: 124 Yathā yathā aham madhyamayāṁ vāyasyāṁ prāviśam 125 Jīvitam ca parityajya anyad ajīvam prāpaṁ 126 Tathā ayam mām parityajya anyam prāpa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Quando di carne a spirto era salita, 128 e bellezza e virtù cresciuta m’era, 129 fu’ io a lui men cara e men gradita;
query.error: **English:** 127 When from flesh to spirit she had ascended, 128 and beauty and virtue had grown in me, 129 I was less dear and less pleasing to him;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 e volse i passi suoi per via non vera, 131 imagini di ben seguendo false, 132 che nulla promession rendono intera.
query.error: **English:** 130 and he turned his steps on an untrue path, 131 following false images of good, 132 which fulfill no promise completely.
query.result: 130 Sa ca svakān padān mārge mithyānivarttayām āsa, 131 Kalyāṇasya mithyāpratimāḥ anudhavataḥ, 132 Yāḥ śubhāśiṣaḥ samyak na pūrayanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 Né l’impetrare ispirazion mi valse, 134 con le quali e in sogno e altrimenti 135 lo rivocai: sì poco a lui ne calse!
query.error: **English:** 133 Nor did my entreaties avail me, 134 with which, both in dreams and otherwise, 135 I recalled him: so little did he care!
query.result: 133 Na ca mama prārthanāphalam alabhata, 134 Yābhiḥ svapne ca anyathā ca 135 Tam āhuvam: tathā hi tasya na kiñcid api rūciḥ āsīt!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Tanto giù cadde, che tutti argomenti 137 a la salute sua eran già corti, 138 fuor che mostrarli le perdute genti.
query.error: **English:** 136 So low he had fallen that all arguments 137 for his salvation were now too short, 138 except to show him the lost people.
query.result: 136 Tathā adho 'apatat saḥ, yataḥ sarve prayatnāḥ 137 Tasya kṣemāya adhunā atihrasvāḥ āsīt, 138 Vinā tena darśayitum tasmai naṣṭān janān.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Per questo visitai l’uscio d’i morti, 140 e a colui che l’ha qua sù condotto, 141 li prieghi miei, piangendo, furon porti.
query.error: **English:** 139 For this reason I visited the gate of the dead, 140 and to the one who led him up here, 141 my prayers, weeping, were carried.
query.result: 139 Asya nimittam mṛtyulokasya dvāram adhyāsam, 140 yaś ca enam iha ānayiṣyat, 141 tasmai mama prārthanāḥ, rudan, nītāḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 Alto fato di Dio sarebbe rotto, 143 se Letè si passasse e tal vivanda 144 fosse gustata sanza alcuno scotto
query.error: **English:** 142 The high decree of God would be broken, 143 if Lethe were crossed and such food 144 were tasted without any penalty
query.result: 142 Ūrdhvaṃ daivam̐ devānāṃ bhinnam̐ syāt, 143 yadi letāṃ taranti evaṃvidhāṃ ca bhojanāṃ 144 aśnanti anena vinā prayaścittena

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
145 di pentimento che lagrime spanda».
query.error: **English:** 145 of repentance that sheds tears.
query.result: 145 yaḥ aśru-bindu-vikṣepaḥ.
